intro: Mapouria tsaratananensis var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy mapouria, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded forest environments, often at higher elevations. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanical research.
